Definitions: The date that the agreement goes into effect and the obligations of the parties commence.
The O&M provider responsible for maintaining and operating the system to meet performance metrics.
The individual or entity that owns the system and receives the benefits of its production.
The date on which the O&M services officially begin under the agreement.
The assurance provided by the Provider that the system will produce a certain amount of energy.
The duration during which the Production Guarantee is applicable.
The projected amount of energy the system is expected to produce over a specific period.
The expected reduction in the system's energy production capacity over time due to wear and aging.
The ratio or metric used to measure the system's actual production against its estimated production.
The conditions and exclusions that apply to the Production Guarantee, outlining circumstances where the guarantee may not be enforced.
The rate or amount of monetary compensation owed by the Provider to the Customer for each unit of energy not produced as guaranteed.
The method used to calculate adjustments for production losses due to factors like maintenance or unforeseen events.

Specifies the conditions under which payments are to be made by the O&M provider to REA under the Production Guarantee; details the schedule, amounts, and penalties applicable if the PV system does not meet the agreed-upon production KPIs and metrics
A formal declaration by the Provider detailing the terms and conditions of the Production Guarantee, including any applicable limitations and obligations.
